TopicTitle: What does your Jeb do now?

Articles.Content:
We all know Jeb. He was the first, he was the greatest, but what is he doing now?

Mine for example has been reduced to the space equivalent of a bus driver. He goes from station to station carrying people. He`s currently on his way to Eve station to refuel on the way to Moho.

Are there any Jebs who still taste adventure?

Is he still a test pilot?

Does he stay at KSC?

Has he moved to laythe? ( I hear the surfing is good )

Tell us what your Jeb is doing now!
Sitting around a conference table in KSC yelling at Bob for something
Sitting in a unconnected pod at KSC so he can't do anything stupid.
hurling towards the sun at 15000 mp/s

*Thanks to Subassembly Loader which lets me choose which pilot i want to take*

Jeb is still my #1 Pilot for very expensive/important/dangerous flight (of course there are precautions to assure his safety (i wonder if I'm evil because my other pilots never get anything like that ) )

Bob is sitting inside our latest orbital station around Kerbin and Bill is training our new test-plane-pilots. (Bill got promoted to the Spaceplanehanger)
I try to have him on every manned launch, test flights, building interplanetcrafts, landing on varius palnets and moons ect. so i guess he's really an all-rounder-type.
He was on my first interstellar flight only using a seat. He kinda vanished around 2000 T above Kerbol.

After returning from a mission to plant a flag on an arch and feed a rover to to the mun(engineers at KSC insist it was part of the original mission), I sent jeb out to bop to make sure IT was still dead and plant a flag on it's courpse. Then i sent him to Pol because i brought way to much fuel, and now he is on the surface with 8km of Dv waiting for me to decide where to go next.
Landed on the Mun in the name of the KCST by the Neil Armstrong memorial, and then died in an experimental segway accident.

My Jeb is overseeing construction of Atlas Station, my flagship orbital command centre.

Once it is complete he shall be returning to Kerbin to design a large modular Mun base complex and the rovers that will aid its construction once on the surface.

He seems particularly excited about the rovers... He's sent in multiple requests to KSC's R&D department already for lots and lots of rocket engines.
Sitting with Bob and Bill in a 3 man pod on the runway.
Right now he's at KSC training as the commander of my prime crew for my third attempt to land on Vall.
I shoved him in some hitchhiker capsule on a space-station just to get him out of the way.

I am fairly new to this game and I got Jeb on my first attempt at a Mun landing after starting anew in 0.2. Mission went well for a first time without MechJeb but a flaw in the landers design made the engine blow up upon touch down on the Mun.

So my answer is, Jeb is now stranded on the Mun awaiting a rescue mission.

Stuck on the Mun with Bill and Bob, awaiting rescue.

(anyone else notice that the spell check recognizes the word Mun?)

My Jeb is stuck in an eccentric Eve orbit in a lander withoud fuel going in the opposite direction of the ship he undocked from to land on Gilly. Currently doing a kethane mission to get him and the ship refueled.
He's currently in a pod with Bill and Bob in Low Kerbin Orbit awaiting new and exciting adventures. No way I'm risking them on the menial tasks I'm currently performing.
Commanding the space station I have around Kerbin and waiting for the phase angle to go to Duna so he can be the first Kerbal to set foot there.
He's dead and doesn't appear to be coming back anytime soon.

My Jeb came home from a 17-year Grand Tour, and immediately volunteered to lift some ion-powered satellites on an SSTO spaceplane. I was more than willing to oblige, since I didn't want him around during the tests of my new plane designs (which have been extremely problematic), so once he lifted the probes I just left him up there, orbiting Kerbin in a small spaceplane. I'll bring him home once it's time for the next big adventure.

Mine is currently running away from his lander module, which, due to an unfortunate mishap involving a jetpack, the lander, and several crates of Mun-beer, is now forever rolling down a mountain. Naturally, he lacks the intellect to merely move out of the way.
Stranded on the south pole, because he jumped out of his plane and tried to RCS before he landed

Last I saw Jeb he was hanging ten on a rocket cycle on his way to Duna.

-Lego
Went back from his 2 days lasting 2nd Trip to Mun and is now in quarantine with Bill and Bob, in praparation for his next mission, whenever this will be
My Jeb was killed by the kraken, and then mysteriously came back to life during the next flight.
